attributes.action: A new referendum on: Should the UK remain a member of the EEA or leave the EEA?
attributes.additional_details: There may be many people who voted "Leave the EU", but never thought the UK should leave the EEA as well. A referendum to clarify this would cost much less than what a "Hard Brexit" could cost the country. The bare existence of the UK itself as we know it is at stake with another Scottish referendum looming.
attributes.background: The UK should leave the EU. This is what the people voted for. However if only 1 in 10 people who voted “Leave the EU" meant “Leave the EU but not the EEA”, the UK government is making a grave mistake. Hence a new referendum is needed with exactly the same rules as the previous one.
